vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
εἰλικρίν-εια [ρῐ], ἡ,
unmixedness, purity, opposed to μίξις, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; in bad sense, unrelievedness, κακοῦ [Refs 1st c.BC+]
__II sincerity, uprightness, [NT+3rd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: sincerity, the positive moral quality of purity (especially in motives), a figurative extension of an unadulterated or unmixed substance
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
sincerity, the positive moral quality of purity (especially in motives), a figurative extension of an unadulterated or unmixed substance
clearness, purity;, metaphorically sincerity, integrity, ingenuousness, 1Cor. 5:8; 2Cor. 1:12; 2:17*
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: sự chân thành; sự chân thực; một cách thánh sạch
